text: please help me to find out the issue
<@U2URL5G8P>  - how exactly are you running your peer(s)?   If using the defaults, I think you want to use port 7051 instead of 7053

I am trying to run chaincode_example02 with two peers started using docker-compose-2.yml file.
I am able to register the chaincode successfully with a name mycc
But not able to use the name further for query or invoke,Getting an Error: Error querying chaincode: rpc error: code = 2 desc = "Error:Failed to launch chaincode spec(Could not get deployment transaction for mycc - LedgerError - ResourceNotFound: ledger: resource not found)"
Any help will be more useful,Struck at this for long time
<@U2URL5G8P> perhaps it should be `CORE_PEER_ADDRESS=0.0.0.0:7051` ?
<@U0PB67X4K>  yes by default i try to use the port 7053 it gaves me  same error  as  above

text: <@U34TJFSCB|shaggy_kp> has joined the channel

ping me in the AM and I can help you
<@U35MH0W7Q|leecharles> has joined the channel

I have some questions,

1. Is it possible to getState() concurrently? is there any lock? Can I actually getState in parallel?
2. For every single chaincode, we will get its chainhash once deployment. However, in the case that we need to modify the chaincode, we will have a different hash. The question is that, how can we retain those states from the old chaincode to the new one. Is it possible to do?

<@U1T95QCUE> 
1) What do you mean by getState() concurrently? Concurrently getState from Node SDK? from same smart contract within same node?
2) No at current v0.6 (unless you are running in DEV mode), which means it requires data migration your old states to new chaincode (with new hash). Only in v1.0 has the "upgrade chaincode feature"

Thanks <@U1JAPLQSY>
1) I mean the chaincode in Go, when one line of code is doing getState(), will it get lock if I make another thread to getState() on the same key?
2) So, we need to wait for v1.0 then.

<@U1T95QCUE> Re: #1, I don't think so. But where is there another thread?? Do you mean another executing contract method (that attempts to getState with same key) when there is another one executing in parallel on same node?
Why is there* not where is there...

<@U1JAPLQSY> We implemented a very heavy method during query, I mean a lot getState() there. So, we are thinking about to make another thread to getState() in parallel. If no lock during getState(), it's worth to try this in parallel, if possible.
<@U354DJJAG|tobiasdisse> has joined the channel
<@U354GGYFN|zhihong> has joined the channel
<@U1T95QCUE> Although technically feasible, I don't recommend to do so... Have you considered applying Event Sourcing and CQRS pattern over your application
The blockchain ledger is a typical event store (append-only write)
it is specialized as a write model, I understand there is a "query" method in each contract. However, we should use different read view for different use case.
Otherwise, your read performance wont be too good
umm... I should ask, what is the purpose of that heavy query method?
for application side use in one organization / by all participants in business network?

Thanks <@U1JAPLQSY> I'm not so sure much about Event Sourcing, CQRS.
Anyway, we are now trying to do a kind of information retrieval through a blockchain.
That's why, it's heavy query
of course, we can just use elasticsearch or what ever, but we just what to try this out to see if HL can handle this POC
ic, I think HL can handle the "many getState" calls well
but seemed, slooooow :disappointed:
lol
we also try getRange, then.. slower
well, it's not a RDBMS... but a Key-value store...
so getRange is just scanning i think*

btw, I found this issue during our query
<https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1163>
when a query over 30sec, chaincode just crash out
if you have an idea, please also check
well, not much idea...
that's alright, we will try parallel getState, to see what will happen
<@U1JAPLQSY> <@U1T95QCUE> I suggest to use timestamp check to instead of key lock.
<@U2U9QNL6A> please elaborate more!
<@U2U9QNL6A> not sure about this, actually
we can store json data in rocksdb, just like {"val":"xxxx", "rev": "1234567890"}
before we update value, we need to check if the rev is right.
after update the value, we need update a value for rev.
just like cloudantDB
hmmmm

we currently do not directly access to rockdb, not sure much about this.
thanks anyway, we will have bit discussion on this for sure.
<@U352H5H8A|alch> has joined the channel

Question: Speed of Invoke: We have tested the speed of "Invoke". It takes 200ms to complete. It seems slow. Is it normal? (The "Invoke" put a simple state; It involves 2 peers on same machine.) Thanks you.
(We use REST to invoke. Actually, we want to see how many requests can be handled per seconds for the invoke.)
We had tested such case. Normal speed can be 80 tps in notebook.
Thanks <@U2U9QNL6A>. How many peer nodes (over network)? With TLS configured? I assume you are putting variable in invoke too. I assume you are using notebook around i7 cpu. Thank you.
<@U2Y2V95D2> I just run one peer with production mode in VM(1 cpu, 2G mem). And tested with Jmeter, the result is about 80 tps.
Cool. Thanks <@U2U9QNL6A>.
<@U2Y2V95D2> it's only v0.5-preview.
<@U34D2ETCZ|zhangxq> has joined the channel

Hi ,

We are running fabric in prod mode which requires the git repo path at the time of chaincode deployment.
Currently we are unable to deploy the code from a private git repo. Is there a way around this? Could anybody please help on this issue?

Thanks
<@U1X0KAHL1> you can use local path instead of git repo path.
<@U2U9QNL6A> Is it possible to do that in production mode now? I thought we had to give the git repo path in prod mode.
<@U1X0KAHL1> it's possible, if you can upload your chaincode source to the peer server before.
<@U1X0KAHL1> I'm using docker env, I attach some volumes to contain the chaincode, and then call deploy with local path, it's OK.

<@U2U9QNL6A> I am also using docker env with docker-compose to bring my peer & member services up. This is how my docker-compose.yml looks like.
membersrvc:
  image: membersrvc
  ports:
    - "50051:50051"
    - "7054:7054"
  command: membersrvc
vp1:
  image: peer
  ports:
    - "5000:5000"
    - "7050:7050"
    - "30303:30303"
    - "30304:30304"
    - "7051:7051"
  environment:
    - CORE_PEER_ADDRESSAUTODETECT=false
    - CORE_SECURITY_PRIVACY=false
    #- CORE_PEER_DISCOVERY_ROOTNODE=9.109.251.50:7051
    - CORE_VM_ENDPOINT=unix:///var/run/docker.sock
    - CORE_LOGGING_LEVEL=DEBUG
    - CORE_PEER_ID=vp1
    - CORE_SECURITY_ENABLED=true
    - CORE_SECURITY_ENROLLID=test_vp0
    - CORE_SECURITY_ENROLLSECRET=MwYpmSRjupbT
    - CORE_PEER_PKI_ECA_PADDR=membersrvc:7054
    - CORE_PEER_PKI_TCA_PADDR=membersrvc:7054
    - CORE_PEER_PKI_TLSCA_PADDR=membersrvc:7054
    - CORE_CHAINCODE_DEPLOYTIMEOUT=60000
  volumes:
    - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
  links:
    - membersrvc
  command: sh -c "sleep 5; peer node start"

Could you suggest how do i attach the volume to contain our local chaincode?

volumes:
    - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    - /Users/XXX/xxx/chaincodes:/opt/gopath/src/chaincodes
<@U2U9QNL6A> Will try this. Thanks
<@U1X0KAHL1> good luck!

anyone have an idea what should be an ENV name for numbuckets value in a core.yaml file
is this correct? -- >CORE_LEDGER_STATE_DATASTRUCTURE_CONFIGS_NUMBUCKETS

<@U2U9QNL6A> I am deploying using swagger and trying to give my local path "/Users/matpasha/Jarvis1/Chaincode" for deployment but it fails with the following error "Error when deploying chaincode: Path to chaincode does not exist: /Users/matpasha/Jarvis1/Chaincode" what am I doing wrong? Thanks
<@U1X0KAHL1> you need use guest local path instead of your host path

<@U1X0KAHL1> for example: 
volumes:
  - /Users/XXX/xxx/chaincodes:/opt/gopath/src/chaincodes

your chaincode is /Users/XXX/xxx/chaincodes/hello/hello.go

you need use "chaincodes/hello" as chaincode path.
Brilliant. It worked Thanks a ton <@U2U9QNL6A>.
